page.title: 07FARMING (CONT)/LANDSCAPE
page.content: FRUIT FARM: Keston Fruit Farm has a lower acreage put down to fruit trees. There are 35 acof apples of thirteen different varieties and Conference and Comic pears. Many apples go to make Cider. About 80 acres are down to whaet and barley. LANDSCAPE: Considering this area is within the London Borough of Bromley it offers a surprisingly rural landscape.The land use divides broadly into two sections, agricultural and woodland.Woods are on the higher ground over 100m and on the steeper slopes. The agricultural land is dominated by cereal production in the east and pastureland in the west. Considering the relief of the land which is gently undulating and relatively steep for cultivation the proportion of cereals is high.
